[ENVIRONMENT].name: ENV
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The logical name of the deployment, must be unique across all environments using the same shared Kafka/Elasticsearch clusters, `a-z (any case)`, `0-9`, `-`, `_` symbols only allowed

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_HOST
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Kafka broker hostname

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_PORT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Kafka broker port

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SECURITY_PROTOCOL
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Kafka security protocol used to communicate with brokers (SSL or PLAINTEXT)

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SSL_KEYSTORE_LOCATION
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The location of the Kafka key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SSL_KEYSTORE_PASSWORD
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The store password for the Kafka key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if 'ssl.keystore.location' is configured.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SSL_TRUSTSTORE_LOCATION
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The location of the Kafka trust store file.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SSL_TRUSTSTORE_PASSWORD
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The password for the Kafka trust store file. If a password is not set, trust store file configured will still be used, but integrity checking is disabled.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_EVENTS_CONSUMER_PATTERN
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Custom subscription pattern for Kafka consumers.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_EVENTS_CONCURRENCY
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Custom number of kafka concurrent threads for message consuming.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_CONSUMER_EVENTS_MAX_POLL_RECORDS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Maximum number of records returned in a single call to poll() for 'instance|holdings-record|item|bound-with' events.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_CONSUMER_EVENTS_MAX_POLL_INTERVAL_MS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Maximum processing time allowed for consumer on 'instance|holdings-record|item|bound-with' events.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_AUTHORITIES_CONSUMER_PATTERN
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Custom subscription pattern for Kafka authority message consumers.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_AUTHORITIES_CONCURRENCY
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Custom number of kafka concurrent threads for authority message consuming.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_REINDEX_RANGE_INDEX_CONCURRENCY
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Custom number of kafka concurrent threads for `search.reindex.range-index` message consuming.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_REINDEX_RANGE_INDEX_TOPIC_PARTITIONS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Amount of partitions for `search.reindex.range-index` topic.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_REINDEX_RANGE_INDEX_TOPIC_REPLICATION_FACTOR
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Replication factor for `search.reindex.range-index` topic.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_REINDEX_RECORDS_CONCURRENCY
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Custom number of kafka concurrent threads for `inventory.reindex-records` message consuming.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_CONSUMER_MAX_POLL_RECORDS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Maximum number of records returned in a single call to poll().

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specifies time to wait before reattempting query.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_RETRY_DELIVERY_ATTEMPTS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specifies how many queries attempt to perform after the first one failed.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: ELASTICSEARCH_URL
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Elasticsearch URL

[ENVIRONMENT].name: ELASTICSEARCH_USERNAME
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Elasticsearch username (not required for dev envs)

[ENVIRONMENT].name: ELASTICSEARCH_PASSWORD
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Elasticsearch password (not required for dev envs)

[ENVIRONMENT].name: ELASTICSEARCH_COMPRESSION_ENABLED
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specify if Elasticsearch request/response compression enabled

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_HOST
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres hostname

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_PORT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres port

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_USERNAME
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres username

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_PASSWORD
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres username password

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_DATABASE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres database name

[ENVIRONMENT].name: INDEXING_DATA_FORMAT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Format for passing data to elasticsearch (json/smile)

[ENVIRONMENT].name: INSTANCE_CHILDREN_INDEX_ENABLED
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Defines if module should process subjects/contributors/classifications/call-numbers in a background

[ENVIRONMENT].name: INSTANCE_CHILDREN_INDEX_DELAY_MS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Scheduler delay for indexing subjects/contributors/classifications

[ENVIRONMENT].name: INSTANCE_CHILDREN_INDEX_BATCH_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Batch size for indexing subjects/contributors/classifications

[ENVIRONMENT].name: INITIAL_LANGUAGES
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Comma separated list of languages for multilang fields

[ENVIRONMENT].name: MAX_SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Provides the maximum number of supported languages

[ENVIRONMENT].name: SYSTEM_USER_USERNAME
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Username for `mod-search` system user

[ENVIRONMENT].name: SYSTEM_USER_PASSWORD
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Password for `mod-search` system user (not required for dev envs)

[ENVIRONMENT].name: OKAPI_URL
[ENVIRONMENT].description: OKAPI URL used to login system user, required

[ENVIRONMENT].name: SEARCH_BY_ALL_FIELDS_ENABLED
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specifies if globally search by all field values must be enabled or not (tenant can override this setting)

[ENVIRONMENT].name: BROWSE_SUBJECTS_ENABLED
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specifies if globally browse instance subject feature is enabled

[ENVIRONMENT].name: BROWSE_CONTRIBUTORS_ENABLED
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specifies if globally browse instance contributor feature is enabled

[ENVIRONMENT].name: BROWSE_CLASSIFICATIONS_ENABLED
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specifies if globally browse instance classification feature is enabled

[ENVIRONMENT].name: BROWSE_CALL_NUMBERS_ENABLED
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specifies if globally browse instance call-number feature is enabled

[ENVIRONMENT].name: SCROLL_QUERY_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The number of records to be loaded by each scroll query. 10000 is a max value

[ENVIRONMENT].name: STREAM_ID_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specifies time to wait before reattempting query.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: STREAM_ID_RETRY_ATTEMPTS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Specifies how many queries attempt to perform after the first one failed.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: STREAM_ID_CORE_POOL_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The number of threads to keep in the pool, even if they are idle.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: STREAM_ID_MAX_POOL_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The maximum number of threads to allow in the pool.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: STREAM_ID_QUEUE_CAPACITY
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The capacity of the queue.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: SEARCH_QUERY_TIMEOUT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The maximum time to wait for search query response

[ENVIRONMENT].name: MAX_BROWSE_REQUEST_OFFSET
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The maximum elasticsearch query offset for additional requests on browse around

[ENVIRONMENT].name: REINDEX_LOCATION_BATCH_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Defines number of locations to retrieve per inventory http request on locations reindex process

[ENVIRONMENT].name: MAX_SEARCH_BATCH_REQUEST_IDS_COUNT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Defines maximum batch request IDs count for searching consolidated items/holdings in consortium

[ENVIRONMENT].name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The range size that represents the number of merge entities to process during the Merge process of reindex

[ENVIRONMENT].name: REINDEX_UPLOAD_RANGE_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The range size that represents the number of upload entities to process during the Upload process of reindex

[ENVIRONMENT].name: REINDEX_UPLOAD_RANGE_LEVEL
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The level of deepness of upload range generator affecting the number of ranges to be generated

[ENVIRONMENT].name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_PUBLISHER_CORE_POOL_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The number of threads for publishing the merge ranges to keep in the pool, even if they are idle.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_PUBLISHER_MAX_POOL_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The maximum number of threads for publishing the merge ranges to allow in the pool.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_PUBLISHER_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The retry interval in ms for reindex merge range request publishing.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_PUBLISHER_RETRY_ATTEMPTS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The maximum number of retries for reindex merge range request publishing.
